subject: Sales
title: The Yes Ladder
description: A fast breakdown of The Yes Ladder for builders.

hook.text: A salesman starts with 'Nice weather, right?' Then: 'You value your family's safety, correct?'

buildup.text: The yes ladder stacks small agreements that build momentum toward a bigger commitment.

discovery.text: Each yes creates consistency pressure. The brain wants to stay aligned with its previous answers.

twist.text: Saying no after a chain of yeses feels psychologically uncomfortable. That's by design.

climax.text: Design conversations as gentle escalations. By the close, agreement feels like the natural answer.

punchline.text: Stack small yeses and the big one follows.

quiz.question: Why does saying 'no' become harder after a series of 'yeses'?
options: People forget they can say no
